intro: Vitex cochinchinensis, commonly known as the Vietnamese chaste tree, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves and showy, clustered purple or blue flowers. The plant produces small, woody fruits that contain several seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in forest margins or open areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and landscapes in tropical and subtropical regions.
